Reviews.Title: “Very central and quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: RonnieB4
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this lovely quaint hotel - extremely central in location and a fabulous view.. the rooms are in good contition and the breakfast on the roof was indeed the highlight , overlooking the blue mosque and Istanbul.. Staff were very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay in this place if you're looking for comfort”
Reviews.Author: oranggilaDoha
Reviews.Content: Bed is without duvet, blanket provided was only a big bathrobe, you can see the metal suspension of the bed because it's old and lame. Electricity power inside the bathroom is down when you turn on your shower, but when you turn off your shower, it'll be brighter again. water closet is sucks, dirty even when we just step in but we cant complain coz the Receptionist is not so friendly and please please give the receptionist exact amount of money bcoz when you ask for the change, he'll say later and later until you forgot (it's not happen only to me but also with some other guests). Breakfast is so poor unlike other hotels in Sultanahmet which provides several types of ham, cheese, corn flakes, milk, coffee, tea. In this hotel, they only provide you with bread and jam, cucumber and tomato, tea and cofee! Even when my mom asked for water, they say you have to buy it with additional cost! But when a Turkish guest is asking, they give it for free. And they will watch you out if you're not moving from the breakfast place bcoz they think you're gonna eat more. What's the matter with them? There is a tram station downstairs so dont expect a quiet sleep coz it stops around 10pm and starts maybe around 7am. The elevator is the old-kind one so insecure. I will never recommend anyone to stay here ever!

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: DESPOINA G Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: it was nice but the rooms are old. Location is perfect!!!! service is kind.the rooms are old but clean.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: cosmopolitan-NL
Reviews.Content: What a horrible place this is! Just do not stay there. They sell rooms with all kind of services,but the rooms do not have all of this: a working TV, minibar and bathtop Wifi etc. The room was dirty with hair (not mine) in the shower and the ceiling was peeling off in 5 places in my room due to a moisture problem. Dust and flakes were all over my bed and bed side table. The curtains did not close as well and there were pistacho's on the floor from a former guest I suppose. Just a cheap place not worth one star. The Breakfast is poor compared to other places in the same price categories. All they offer for coffee is nescafe and the staff sat down next to me on a table having breakfast them selves.....so much for the guests. I ran from this hotel and looked for another place to stay in the same area, after they offered me as a single person a room with a double bed and a single bed on the street side, where noisy trams stop all day and night. I found a place 10 times better and for the same price nearby. This place pretends to be gay friendly as well, but I think they miss the boat what that is concerend. I did not feel welcome at all. It is cheapo place for people on a very low budget. The only nice thing is that the BF room, which is poorly appointed, has a view on the Agia Sofia, but it is not worth staying in this place for that. Go next door to the Amassador hotel and you have the same view.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: colinroyw
Reviews.Content: Having read some terrible reviews of this hotel, I was wary of my 3 night visit. However, I enjoyed my stay very much. Ok, the room was in need of a little decoration and the bathroom a little dated and not perfect, but for the price and location, you cannot expect 5 star. The room was clean, comfortable and warm, the staff very helpful and friendly and an excellent breakfast. I would return there as it is a perfect location and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Black and White Restaurant amazing view”
Reviews.Author: mrsboll
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at this hotel but we just happened onto the restaruant the last night in Istanbul. The food and service were good but the real reason for coming here is the view. It overlooks Aya Sofya and the Blue Mosque and whole area including the Bosphorus. Be sure to check it out.

Reviews.Title: “The absolutely worst ever!”
Reviews.Author: greyhounddaddies
Reviews.Content: Filthy sheets, sullen desk clerks, tv not working, bathroom, especially the shower, not fit for humans. Yes, it's on a great street, but just doors down for the same reasonable rate you can stay in a clean decent hotel. This is the worst accomodation I've EVER stayed at and I've been travelling all my life.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T SLEEP IN THE BEDS!!!”
Reviews.Author: fatih2011
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about Petrol hotel is the location. Right in front of Sultanahmet tram station. And that's it! The rooms were filthy, water got cut off, lousy breakfast , forgetful staff. The mattress was caved in...and I realised 3 days later that I had contracted scabies!!!!! Booking through the net promised airport pick-up....they forgot! They paid my return taxi. Pity that hotel could be a gem as its location is ideal. Date of travel was April 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Not recomended”
Reviews.Author: emdad20
Reviews.Content: Only good thing about Petrol Palace is the location. Besides that everything is disappointing. Not so friendly stuff Small room Very small bed Toilet got stuck right after one use and over flowed all over the place. Itâ€™s not worth to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “It was a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Sofia G
Reviews.Content: The ONLY thing we liked here was that that the hotel was placed in the middle of istambul, but the rooms and the bathorooms were terrible!! So dirty and old with a bad smell. Don't stay there more than 1 night because it's awful.

Reviews.Title: “Completely unimpressed! Not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: ksa104
Reviews.Content: The only reason we selected this hotel in the first place was because it is literally right in front of the Sultanahmet tram stop, which we thought would be a convenient way to get to the airport with our heavy luggage. However, there is nothing about this hotel that would compel me to stay there ever again! We were completely unimpressed with (and rather disgusted by) the quality and cleanliness of our room. The hotel looks like it has not had a proper cleaning in a very long time and I was hesitant to even touch anything in the room/bathroom. There are so many other hotel choices in the area from which to choose; there is really no reason why anyone would need to stay here, even if it is very near the tram stop!

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Brian L
Reviews.Content: Family of five adults in a suite (funny) they have most definitely used photographs from elsewhere to advertise. Breakfast was disgraceful, bread, buttter n jam were the safest choice, totally bemused that I was asked too pay for orange juice or water? Stairs dirty, rooms dirty, bathroom absolutely disgusting, shared breakfast with previous nights food still on the floor and table cloths etc. Asked politely too take a photo of Blue mosque at night from restaurant but were refused and confronted with inappropriate comments. We were overcharged from the price quoted but I no longer had the energy or enthusiasm to comment it was only a small amount but principiles apply. Istanbul was fanstastic but please please please do not stay here it will spoil the vibrancy and enjoyment of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! They worry only about getting your advanced payment.”
Reviews.Author: Katerina70
Reviews.Content: I've booked on-line in May '11 a triple room in that hotel for a three nights stay in July (from 05.07 to 08.07). The description of the hotel was excellent not only for its position, but for its facilities too (new elegant and spacious rooms, renovated and refurnished recently, supplied with air conditioning, etc.). At our arival the triple room was not available and the owner of the hotel told us they would give us a suite for the first night without applying any extra charge, ad then we should move to a standard triple room for the next two days. We agreed and he asked for the advanced payment of the ammount for the entire stay. After the payment we were informed that the room was not ready at the moment and that we should wait for two more hours until 1:30 pm. We had a walk and turned back to the hotel at 1:45 pm, but the room was still not ready. The person at the reception desk had changed - it was no more the owner, but a man that said he was the manager. He told us to wait for 30 more minutes and finally, at 2:15 pm he gave us the keys of the room..., but what a surprise!... It was not the suite the owner promised to us, and not even a standard triple room. It was a small, old and dirty double room, without air conditioning, where the distance between the beds was not more than 5cm and the third bed was a small camp-bed. Complete dakay in the bathroom, without a window and with no light: it was old and full of mold. The room was situated on the first floor and its only window was right above the tram station. Considered that the weather was very hot and the air conditioning didn'work, we should keep open the window and suffer the noise from the street all the night. We asked to change our room immediately, but the manager refused and he also refused to put us in contact with the owner. The only sollution he offered to us was an accomodation in another hotel nearby, which had a triple room available with air conditioning, but it was of a lower standard. He said he would arrange for the payment of the same amount to the other hotel (even thow, I'm not sure the price of the second hotel was the same, considered its lower standard). I will never turn back to that hotel and I also don't recommend it to anybody. [-]

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare, deffinitly not even a 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: lefils
Reviews.Content: When i arrived i was shell shocked with room, next to street nd tram, every five min u hear some thing, and the music of next door restaurant that goes on . The rooms was old.. The money paid for this hotel is just wasted.. So noisy .. I could not sleep the whole night .. Dont go there .. U may pay for a small hostel .. Much better than here. The location is excellent but there is no basic relaxation in it. Second worst hotel ever in my life.. I started to hate istanbul beause of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: gdgc
Reviews.Content: I almost cancelled my booking at this hotel after reading some of the negative comments. I am really glad I did not. Initially I was very unhappy with the room I was given but the hotel staff, whom I found pleasant and helpful, found me an alternate room that looked out over the park to the Blue Mosque. Magical! The room, while basic, was clean and comfortable. Unlike other reviewers, I was not troubled at all by the noise from the street and park. Quite the contrary - it made me constantly aware that I was in a vibrant city. There was ample food on the breakfast buffet and it was always fresh. This hotel represents exceptional value for money, especially given its location within walking distance to most attractions. And as for the tram stop right outside the hotel? You could not ask for a more convenient way to travel to other parts of the city. I certainly would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever been to.”
Reviews.Author: Password74
Reviews.Content: Rooms are tiny. Nothing worked Reception staff are so rude. Breakfast consisted of bread butter ect and coffee only. Hotels.com who recommended this hotel are a total con. And advertise misleading info abt this so called hotel. Never use hotels.com or this hotel. Ruined our whole stay. Whilst in beautiful Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid At All Costs”
Reviews.Author: Curnster
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at this hotel 3 months in advance, and the day before I was due to fly the cancelled due to "an issue with the booking" (they had overbooked). The member of staff that I spoke to was rude and unco-operative and hung up on me. I had to find alternative accommodation at just a few hours notice. I would suggest that you avoid this hotel at all costs. It is cheap but I guess you get what you pay for. Rubbish.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: moveinon
Reviews.Content: This is not a 5 star hotel. But it is in a great location to get to everything in old town Sultanahmet and was clean and comfortable. We stayed there twice in two months and everything was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good value”
Reviews.Author: Silverflyingscot
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews on this hotel I was wary about booking however despite finding it rather 'tired' and in need of a complete refurbishment, my bed was clean and comfortable. Although the bathroom tiles need some attention, there was plenty of hot water. Breakfast was a typical turkish meal with, in my opinion, more than sufficient choices. I cannot stand tourists who travel to other countries and complain that breakfast is not what they would like - in Turkey olives, cheese, tomatoes, cucumber and bread are the main part of the breakfast One thing that I did not like was that despite the ruling for non smoking in Turkey, there was at times a smokey atmosphere and the owners did smoke in the restaurant - now against the law! I would however stay again in this hotel if I was to find myself in Istanbul, just loved the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location (despite the wake up call)”
Reviews.Author: the_ange23
Reviews.Content: -Hotel & Room The room was fairly basic but had the usual essentials that you needed. My room was at the front side of the building and on the second floor so I was right near the main road. With the window open, you could hear much of the noise below and the Turkish style music. But if you closed the window, the noise wasn't really an issue. The shower/bath was small but sufficient. And there were a few broken things around the room but it was okay. Also, I had to ask for a top sheet. Also, there is a terrace on the top floor with a great view of the Blue Mosque. They offer breakfast, lunch and dinner but I did not eat here other than breakfast. -Location Great Location! Right next to the Sultanahmet Tram Stop so you could catch the tram to various places. Alternatively, you were on the main road where all the shops were so you could walk to the Grand Bazaar and the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, etc. The only down side was that there is a mosque right across the road and when they have their Call to Pray at about 5:30am, you can hear it! -Service The staff were very nice. One guy even took me up the road to show me which Turkish Delights I should get. However, it seemed they were very much pushing me to eat in their restaurant. The breakfast was fairly basic with just some bread, cheese, salad bits, etc. Coffee and Tea but no water. Free Wifi was available but was not very fast in the rooms. I had to sit in the corridor.

Reviews.Title: “Be reasonable !”
Reviews.Author: woodyScotland
Reviews.Content: Some of the reviews I have read regarding Petrol Palace leave me bewildered . My wife and I again visited for the eighth year running,( each time for 2or 3 weeks) and as always we had a lovely time. All the staff, from Mr Karul to the receptionist were very pleasant and attentive. We always find the room and bedding clean, and have only once in all our visits had to compain.----- ( that the light bulb needed changing ) It is easy to be negative ,but you don't go to a buget hotel and expect the Hilton !! The big plusses for the hotel are it's central location , all the places of interest (ie) Blue Mosque. Grand Bazzar, Topkapy Palace, Hagi Sophia ,Museum, are all just a few minutes walk away And the tramway to places further afield at the front door. August 2011 here we come!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: tezay
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Hotel Petrol for both business travelers and tourists. Regarding the heavy traffic of Istanbul, Hotel Petrol is very well situated and therefore not only is close to historic places and shops for tourists but also close to business centers for business travelers like me. With its competitive price and very well service, I find it one of the best in the area. Once you try it, I am sure you will be one of the regulars like me.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & good price”
Reviews.Author: robertcameron64
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation through booking.com with the reservation number 967839520. It was a lovely stay and i hope i will stay there on my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Petrol Hotel is like a great warm tiny home in the huge city of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: HarryCan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times in Istanbul - Sultanahnmet. Everytime I come back to this fine hotel in de middle of the old city of Istanbul. The view is great. You can see the Sultanahmet Mosque, the Haya Sophia, the Bosphurus. The location is perfect: just next to the tramstop. It is see easy to find your way, to invite friends to meet in front of your hotel. When you want to taste the Turkish culture, the muslim religion; you hear the calls to pray five times a day. As in whole Turkey you can hear these prayers from the minarets like a wave coming over the country. Magnificant sound! The staff is so friendly. My days in Petrol Hotel were splended. The people are so warm, friendly and helpfull. I can strongly recommend this hotel. One tiny thing: though it is forbidden to smoke in public places, there are hotelguests who smoke cigarets in the restaurant .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Price and good hospitality !!!”
Reviews.Author: monto13
Reviews.Content: If you are short on budget, want to stay in the heart of the city and can compromise a bit of hotel bathroom, this is a perfect hotel. Walking distance of Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome, Blue Mosque, Arastaa Bazaar, Turkish and Islamic Museum and lot of cafe and restautrant around. Also just outside is the tram station if you wish to go to Galata Tower, University or Spice Market or almost anywhere. The rooms are cozy and cleaniness is satisfactory but the host Mr Kartal and Mernal weregreat. Standard Breakfast in on the terrace restaurant with the of view Blue Mosque. I would advice to stay for it perfect location, price and hospitality thought hotel rooms and service has lots to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Could be a nice low price hotel but needs interior renovation etc”
Reviews.Author: eva093
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for tourists and a wonderful view overlooking the Blue Mosque from the terrass. Breakfast was ok and I could sleep quite well. Bring earplugs if you don't want to wake up listening to the praying from the minarets. But it is part of the culture. The shopping is better about 2 kilometers up the street. The staff did their best to manage complaints. But the owner/boss needs some training in management and customer service. He seemed surprisingly unintrested in his hotel and the guests problems. He became invisible when he knew we had complaints. He was also quite impolite and rude at times. Some rooms, the hallways and the reception are in inmediatly need of renovations. There are rooms that are ok, but there are also some bad rooms. All this could be fixed quite quick and easily if the owner wants to. Pick-up worked for me but not for everybody. Recommend this hotel, but only because of the nice and funny staff working there. The price is a bit high considering what you get. Ok if you travel alone/for backpackers, nothing for the honeymoon or if you like to party.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: johnny012
Reviews.Content: Me and my spouse went to Istanbul, Turkey for a vacation and we wanted to stay in a cozy hotel with a beautiful view so we have decided to stay in Petrol Hotel because the staff was friendly and kind and the hotel had a beautiful view that you can see the sultanahmet mosque. Everything was wonderful, i will definitely come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here under any circumstances!! This place is diabolical”
Reviews.Author: martinsw2
Reviews.Content: Our trip here got off to a terrible start when no one was at the airport to meet us, despite emailing our flight details to the Hotel and confirming this by phone a couple of days before our arrival. We flew into SAW not IST and made this clear on our booking and agreed to pay the 20 Euro extra for this. When no one was there to meet us, a kind man saw we were lost and arranged a transfer by shared mini bus for us. When we arrived in the Hotel, the location appeared excellent, as it was right opposite the Blue Mosque, with amazing views over the Bosphorus. When we went to check in, the man on the desk seemed polite enough and he gave us our key and told us there was a lift to the 4th floor. We had been given a "suite" as we were three people sharing and the cost was 77Euro per night. When we got in to the room there was a terrible smell of damp and mould, and we were horrified at the poor quality of the furnishings which looked like an Argos reject jumble sale! The beds were cheap divans resting on the floor, and there were tatty old blankets on them. The phone was not connected, just a loose wire hanging from the wall. The mini bar was full of rust and there was no safe deposit box in the room. The noise from the mosque was very intrusive as the windows did not block out the sound very much at all, and the air-conditioning unit barely functioned at all. We were horrified to say the least, this bore no resemblance to their web-site whatsoever. We almost felt like calling the airline to try and get us home! Luckily I managed to get on the free internet offered by the City of Istanbul (the Hotel's Wifi signal was virtually useless - pretty much like everything else!!) I managed to get us in to the [genuine] four star Hotel Ipek Palas for 100 Euro per night, just 23 Euro more, and in a totally different league. They immediately sent their driver to collect us, and I'm writing this from our room there, breathing a huge sigh of relief. When we asked to check out, I was told we would have to pay for our transfers, and for the first night (which we didn't take) - and so we did this. We were assured we would get a full refund to my credit card, and I have to say that the receptionist tried to be helpful and courteous throughout. However, when you can have a really high standard Hotel for just a few Euros more, I cannot stress enough to avoid this place at all costs! It is certainly not how I would wish to remember Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “please don't go because the hotel is full of fleas”
Reviews.Author: poukie2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Petrol for 1 week. It's DIRTY! From the first day I had already an itch. After 4 days I had a "rash". Now I'm back home and I have a skin full of flea beats. (confirmed by the dermatologist.) I know this is a low budget hotel but hygiene is the basic!!!

Reviews.Title: “dirty and noisy”
Reviews.Author: Green3310
Reviews.Content: to be fair - the staff were very nice (I think actually a bit embarrassed abt the condition of the rooms and hotel generally). The stairs/hall carperts were filthy. The wood laminate floor in the room I was in had lifted in several places, and dirt was just left to gather. The whole place needs refurbishing completely. I had the top floor room, and its probably the noisest room I have ever had to stay in .. and I live in central London. The very loud belly dancing/guitar playing tends to start at 8ish at the restaurant directly above and goes on until late in the evening. The guy working for the hotel/restaurant drags people off the street and puts them in the lift (which stopped outside my room so that they could climb the few stairs upto the restaurant) so the noise from people passing was constant as well as the 'entertainment'. Then at day break you have the 3 very near mosques start with very loud morning prayer .. so not good if you fancy a lie in either. The whole place is shabby and unkept. The rooms were dirty and the linen old. And to be honest, I thought I had booked a gay hotel (as it was advertised). Sadly, there was nothing gay friendly about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever seen in my life!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AB_Munich
Reviews.Content: Believe everything your have read so far - this hotel is so bad, it's unbelievable. I am backpacker myself, who stayed in a lot of tricky places and my requirement are really not high. I have not seen such a bad rip-off somewhere else in the world. First our reservation could not be found by the hotel. For some strange reasons, they did not have any rooms left and they wanted to put us in the basement of the house. The room the staff led us to, was a pure underground basement (raw grey walls, obviously not cleaned floors, old stuff standing around, small barred windows at 3m height, without any glass or light, but you could hear the traffic and the pedestrians and see pedestrians' feet, who were waiting at the railway station right in front of the house). The room was not turned into any kind of hotel room at all. They really had just put two camp beds inside (I am not kidding). As nobody of the staff spoke English I first thought they wanted me to store my backpack in this room until my "real" room would be ready. It took me a while that they seriously wanted me to stay in this dirty basement as a room :-) By the way, the wanted me to pay 70 EUR per night for this "double room". After some fight with the receptionist, I was able to get my money back and we took off and looked for another place to stay. Stay away from this place. It is pure rip-off !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bernese31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Petrol in Sultanahmet and had such a nice time there. The owners are very friendly, playing guitar and singing songs and our small child was just feeling at home there. It is very good locatet, next to the tram stop and near the blue mosque and arround are many nice restaurants. From the receptions we good great informations what we can see in Istanbul and I am sure we will go back to this friendly hotel....

Reviews.Title: “So, so bad I will remember it forever”
Reviews.Author: Tenner_9
Reviews.Content: Similar to many of the reviews here, this place was just unbelievable. The website was pure fiction. 'Boutique hotel'? Ah, no. Honestly, against the international hotel ranking system, a 1 and 1/2 star rating would be generous. In the middle of summer, the room was not only not airconditionecontained, but only contained a small pedestal fan that had to share the one electrical socket in the room with all the other cheap and broken electrical appliances. A bathroom on a scale of dirtyness you wouldn't believe. Hot water not working. Towels falling apart from age, but I think they actually had been washed (wow!). This is a hotel blatantly ripping off tourists, requiring upfront payment on checking in and, thus, locking you in for an experience you won't forget. It was so bad it was good in that it makes for a funny travel story.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Liz G
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this hotel isn't the cleanest and doesn't have the best service, BUT, it's FANTASTIC in terms of location. Overlooking the tram line in Sultanahmet, you are walking distance from the Covered Markets, the Hippodrome, Topkapi Palace, the Cistern, the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia. Then it's just a short tram ride to anywhere else you want to go - the Egyptian Markets, across the Bosphorus to the Galatea Tower, Istiklal Caddesi etc etc... The view from the rooftop breakfast room is also pretty gorgeous. We had a room on the third floor overlooking the tram line. If you like watching the comings and goings of the locals, you'd love this spot. Since we were there in Ramadan, our window overlooked the concert and night markets taking place just opposite the hotel. What an introduction to Istanbul! However, if you're not fond of music and madness, this won't be the spot for you, as the music shop downstairs plays music til all hours. Closing the window helps with the noise, but then the room gets very stuffy, even in September. The beds aren't terribly comfortable, and ours had a bottom sheet but no top sheet until we asked specifically for them. There was only one blanket, but that was sufficient at the time we were there. The bathroom was average - a little cramped, but OK. Breakfasts were light on, but you could order extra things apparently.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect five star and you'll be fine”
Reviews.Author: verbagoston
Reviews.Content: I can't contradict everything what has been written before, but I would underline the values of the hotel from a different aspect. The rooms are not tiptop, neither the building, not the whole staff speaks English and in general: there's a little funny feeling in the hotel. But I wouldn't go elsewhere next time and right because of this funny feeling. I give you the reasons: the location couldn't be better and it is something really important once in Istanbul, even if you trip around the Asian side. The staff has its own style and don't expect anything from a Western European standard 3star: no hostesses, no concierge and no big fuzz around you and your tourist status, but you are well served and you get a close impact what Turkish people really are. I prefer to spend most of the time in KadikÃ¶y on the Asian side and wouldn't really have meals in Sultanahmet, but the breakfast at the hotel's roof terrace is the place and style to start the day with olives, goat cheese and pickles. Summing up all: it is really Turkish, a bit Asian too and it's really worths to stay. If you're not snobbing around if on a trip and staying away from the reality of the certain location, this is a perfect place for you to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dimly lite, cold food, exspensive - dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: TerryParrott
Reviews.Content: The hotel website looks nothing like the hotel today. Its drab, our bathroom was disgusting, any food we had was cold, the heating was unreliable, in general the whole hotel is the pits. The whole hotel is in serious need of urgent refurbishment. When you check in you have to pay the full ammount in advance, I wonder why ?? Dont stay here

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Petrol Palace
HotelInfo.Address: Dr. Eminpasa sok. N:1 | Sultanahmet, Fatih, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
